nird_s3_sync package

NIRD S3 Sync

The The NIRD S3 Sync packages provides a way to fetch data stored on NIRD S3 (Sigma2), and copy/synchronize it with a specified location on another file-system.

Submodules

nird_s3_sync.io module

nird_s3_sync.io.get_file_sha256_checksum(fs, path, chunk_size=1048576)

Get the SHA256-checksum of a file on a file-system.

Parameters:

  • fs (fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem) – File-system instance where the file is located.

  • path (str) – Path of the file on the file-system.

  • chunk_size (int) – Number of bytes to read at a time to update the hash object state.

Returns:

SHA256-checksum.

Return type:

str

nird_s3_sync.io.fs2fs_copy(fs_src, path_src, fs_dest, path_dest, chunk_size=1048576)

Copy a file from one file-system to another.

Copy a file from a file-system instance at a given path, to another file-system instance at a given path. Return the SHA256-checksum computed from the bytes read from the file on the source file-system.

Parameters:

  • fs_src (fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem) – Instance of the (source) file-system where the file to be copied is.

  • path_src (str) – Path of the file to be copied on the source file-system.

  • fs_dest (fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem) – Instance of the (destination) file-system to which the file will be copied.

  • path_dest (str) – Path of the file to be copied on the destination file-system.

  • chunk_size (int, default: 1048576) – Number of bytes to copy at a time. Default is 1048576 (1MB).

Returns:

SHA256-checksum of the file read on the source file-system.

Return type:

str

nird_s3_sync.io.safe_fs2fs_copy(fs_src, path_src, fs_dest, path_dest, chunk_size=1048576, n_retries=3)

Copy a file from one file-system to another and ensure data integrity.

Copy a file from a file-system instance at a given path, to another file-system instance at a given path. Ensure data integrity by computing the SHA256-checksum of the copied file on the destination file-system, and verifying that it matches the checksum computed from the file read on the source file-system.

Parameters:

  • fs_src (fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem) – Instance of the (source) file-system where the file to be copied is.

  • path_src (str) – Path of the file to be copied on the source file-system.

  • fs_dest (fsspec.spec.AbstractFileSystem) – Instance of the (destination) file-system to which the file will be copied.

  • path_dest (str) – Path of the file to be copied on the destination file-system.

  • chunk_size (int, default: 1048576) – Number of bytes to copy at a time. Default is 1048576 (1MB). The same chunk_size will be used to read and compute the checksum of the file copied on the destination file-system.

  • n_retries (int, default: 3) – Maximum number of times to restart the copy operation for, if the data was corrupted while copied. Default is 3.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the data was corrupted while copied, after a given number of attempts (see n_retries).

See also

fs2fs_copy()

Copy file between file-systems with data integrity check.

Return type:

None

nird_s3_sync.utils module

nird_s3_sync.utils.get_credentials()

Get the credentials to access the NIRD S3 bucket.

Raises:

RuntimeError – If the environment variables corresponding to the credentials are not set at runtime.

Returns:

Mapping of the credentials.

Return type:

dict

nird_s3_sync.utils.get_fs(bucket_name)

Get a file-system instance mapping to the NIRD S3 bucket.

Parameters:

bucket_name (str) – Name of the bucket.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the specified bucket does not exist.

Returns:

File-system instance.

Return type:

s3fs.core.S3FileSystem
